Leaves Info: serrated, turns bright orange before falling
Description: This is a tropical fruit found in the Indian Subcontinent, Indo-China and South East Asia. It is an ornamental medium sized tree indigenous to Sri Lanka, producing smooth, ovoid green fruits. The fruit has nutritive and medicinal values. It is an ornamental medium sized tree. Bears smooth ovoid green fruits the size of about 2.5cm long. Recommended varieties are local cultivars (round and oval fruits). It has a brown coloured seed inside the fruit.
Name: Ceylon Olive Tree
